intro: Daviesia cunderdin, commonly known as the Cunderdin Daviesia, is a flowering plant native to Western Australia. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its shrub-like growth habit. The plant produces clusters of small, pink to red flowers during the spring season. Its leaves are narrow and often have a hairy texture, which helps reduce water loss in its arid habitat. Daviesia cunderdin is well adapted to dry conditions and is often found in sandy or rocky soils.
